roleset.name: search, seek, seaking, looking through/for
roleset.note: SEARCH-V NOTES: Comparison with 'seek'.Member of Vncls search-35.2. (from search.01-v)
SEARCH-N NOTES: Roleset based on search.01. Verbnet class search-35.2. Framed by Katie. (from search.01-n)
SEARCHING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, search-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls search-35.2. (from searching.01-n)

example.name: typical transitive
example.text: The board already has been searching for strong outside candidates, including food-industry executives with considerable international experience.
example.arg: for strong outside candidates, including food-industry executives with considerable international experience

example.name: All arguments with (sort of creepy) purpose.
example.text: He searched the crowd for his wife to assign her an appropriate punishment.
example.arg: to assign her an appropriate punishment.

example.name: Example with 2 args
example.text: his search for the Reuters shares

example.name: Example with only arg 2
example.text: the search for `` a real computer in a package so small you cantake it everywhere
example.arg: for `` a real computer in a package so small you can take it everywhere

example.name: Example with 2 args
example.text: The detective's search for clues was fruitless.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: In a search earlier this week of an Aden apartment, detectives found evidence of the crime.

example.name: All Args
example.text: Krauser soon begins his search of Wesker for power.

example.name: all args
example.text: Officials dropped those charges after finding no trace of ricin in Curtis' home, and no record of his searching the Internet about the poison.
